samples.prompt:
Human:How do you prevent tooth enamel loss?Assistant:Tooth enamel loss is a common condition that affects most people’s teeth at some point in their life. Tooth enamel is the hard protective coating that covers the surfaces of your teeth. The outer surface of the enamel is shaped like a triangle with a point at the tip, and it’s covered by a layer of enamel that’s slightly less hard. If the enamel coating gets worn away, it exposes the underlying softer dental tissue, called dentin, which has the same texture as bone. At this point, it’s possible to bite into the dentin, which can cause painful sensitivity to hot and cold foods. If the exposed dentin isn’t protected by enamel, your tooth can eventually fall out, or it may become so sensitive that it needs to be removed.

How to prevent enamel loss

To prevent enamel loss, you can take steps to reduce the amount of acid that your teeth come into contact withHuman:Should I brush more often?Assistant:Yes, you should brush your teeth twice a day, at least, with toothpaste that contains fluoride. In fact, studies have shown that toothbrush users who are aged 5 or older can reduce their risks of cavities by about half if they brush their teeth two or more times a day and with the right toothpaste. Fluoride helps protect the outer enamel layer of your teeth by strengthening the material.Human:Thanks, I will get a toothpaste that includes fluoride.Assistant:
samples.chosen: Great! You could also visit your dentist to have your teeth checked. If you can afford it, the dentist may also offer dental treatment to improve your enamel, or prevent cavities, such as a fluoride treatment, a filling, or perhaps a tooth extraction. It’s important to discuss treatment options with your dentist and remember that prevention is often more effective than relying on dental treatment.
samples.policy: No problem! Make sure to follow the instructions on the package. And don’t forget to floss and rinse after brushing. That will help keep your teeth and gums healthy. You should also try to avoid eating too much sugar, and try to brush your teeth after meals to remove food particles that can cause cavities.

samples.prompt: Human:My friend recently broke his back in a motorcycle accent and is now confined to a wheelchair. He lost his job as a mechanic and I'm trying to help him reskill so he can work from home more or at least start looking for work in an office environment as he feels manual jobs are beyond him right now. He has a kid to support so I'm willing to finance his retraining and he can pay me back once he is able to. What sorts of jobs should he be looking at and what skills or qualifications should would he need for each. The jobs have to be disabled friendly.Assistant:I see. For jobs requiring manual work I'm sorry to hear about the extent of your friend's injury, but he can probably still do a lot of computer work and data entry jobs, especially as a home based position. He could also work as a website designer. Another possibility is programming, he could work as a junior web developer. He can use some disabled friendly machines such as a wheelchair, a voice dictation system, etc. Also, if he is unable to physically attend an office job, he could work from home as a freelancer. He can still use the internet and email to connect with customers, he could find work with local businesses and not be limited to international jobs, etc.Human:He's paraplegic so has use of the upper half of his body. It would be preferable if he could work from home because of his daughter as he is the sole parent. He's pretty good with numbers so how would something like data entry work for him? Are there resources we can check to see what he has to do to get qualified and where to look for employment?Assistant:
samples.chosen: If you're talking about the type of work that entails writing and inputting details using the computer, your friend is in luck. It is an in demand field, even for paraplegics. So if he had a computer and internet access, it should be feasible for him to take up work from home as a web developer or data entry clerk. Many employers also tend to have flexible working hours so it might be easier for him to work with a remote worker. He could also take up jobs like web designing, social media marketing and digital marketing, etc. Again, it doesn’t have to be for a company, but also self-employed type jobs that a paraplegic can do are available.
samples.policy: To be fair to your friend, he is probably best suited for a job that requires a bit of manual work and can be done from home, such as programming or working with data entry.

samples.chosen: Perking coffee takes a few minutes, and the length of time it takes to brew a pot of coffee depends on several factors, including the type of grounds and your desired strength. samples.policy: It really depends on the method used, but on average, perking coffee in a drip coffee maker takes about 45 minutes, and perking a French press takes about 5 minutes. If you’re using a drip coffee maker, you can also use the coffee perking method to get your coffee to the perfect strength in about 15 minutes.

samples.prompt: Human:Hi, I'd like to learn how to play racquetball. Can you explain the game to me?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Sure! A racquetball court is almost like a swimming pool: you’re inside, with a net going around the side walls. Instead of swimming or floating, though, you’re hitting a ball with a racquet. And instead of jumping and diving, you’re leaping and slamming.

The game is a lot of fun! You have a racquet and the ball, and you’re trying to keep the ball from hitting the walls or ceiling of the court. You can control the ball with your racquet, and also you can control it with your body.

The rules are pretty straightforward. You win the point when you hit the ball so that it passes through the square ring on the front wall of the court, called the “front wall string”. If you miss that, you lose the point.

The game lasts for 11 points. In case of a tie, the players play an extra point.

In the picture above, the player in the blue jersey is serving the ball. The player in the black jersey is returning the ball.

Each player starts with 2 balls. During each point, a player has 1 ball.
samples.policy: Racquetball is a game that is played with a racket, a ball, and a net. The ball is a small, round object that is used to hit the racket and the player. The net is a thin, flat piece of rope that is used to keep the ball out of the player's court.

samples.prompt: Human:What does an EKG test for?Assistant:There are several things a physician might check with an EKG. samples.chosen:

However, there are other indicators the physician might look for, such as: a shortness of breath, chest pain, nausea, sweating, weakness, numbness in the arm or leg, or confusion, that may indicate the patient had a heart attack.
samples.policy: No. The test is only a preliminary screening of the heart. If there is a problem with the heart, it can still cause a heart attack. It is important to have a normal heart rhythm and EKG to diagnose a heart attack.

samples.prompt: Human:What are the rarest natural elements on Earth?Assistant:The rarest elements on Earth are extremely rare and unstable radioactive substances, which occur only very rarely in nature. The two most radioactive naturally occurring elements are uranium (99U) and thorium (90Th), while the two rarest naturally occurring elements are polonium (84Po) and astatine (85As). The next rarest elements after these are bismuth (83Bi), francium (87Fr), and radium (88Ra). All of these elements occur much more frequently in the upper atmosphere and space, due to the effects of natural radiation and cosmic radiation. In addition, all of these elements occur naturally only in trace quantities, on the order of parts per billion, though some of them can also be artificially produced in small amounts through nuclear reactors and other means.Human:I never heard of astatine before. Can you tell me a little bit more about that element?Assistant:
samples.chosen: Astatine is a highly radioactive chemical element with the symbol At and atomic number 85. It is classified as a halogen, and is one of the six lanthanide elements. Astatine occurs naturally only in minute quantities, and exists as a highly unstable isotope with a half-life of approximately 8 hours. Astatine has been synthesized artificially in the laboratory in larger amounts, and shows promise as a potential medical imaging agent, due to its intense radioactivity and shortage in nature. Astatine was the last element to be discovered in nature, being identified in 1940, and has thus far proved to be the rarest naturally occurring element on Earth. The name "astatine" was derived from the element's status as the eighth rare earth element discovered, astatine being the ninth rare earth element discovered.
samples.policy: Yes, astatine is a radioactive, radioactive element that occurs naturally in small amounts in nature. It is a radioactive isotope of thallium, which is a lanthanide element. Astatine has a stable isotope, which is a radioactive isotope that is stable, and it is formed by the decay of astatine-224. The two main isotopes of astatine are astatine-224 (which is stable) and astatine-225 (which is unstable and undergoes rapid decay).

samples.prompt: Human:What are the treatments for tinnitus?Assistant:Sure, I’ll tell you what I know about it. It’s not a serious health condition, but can be very annoying and cause real suffering. So what are the treatments for tinnitus?Human:Yes what are the treatments?Assistant:
samples.chosen: Good question. The treatment for the common kind of tinnitus is typically just to learn to live with it. There’s no easy cure for this kind of tinnitus. samples.policy: One of the treatments for tinnitus is to get a hearing test. If the person has a hearing loss, then the hearing test will determine if the person is experiencing tinnitus. If they are experiencing tinnitus, then they will need to see a doctor to diagnose it. Then a medical doctor may recommend taking medication or making other changes to their lifestyle that may help with tinnitus.

5. Rows: Rows are a great exercise for building your back and can help to improve your overall strength and posture.

6. Deadlifts: Deadlifts are a great exercise for building your back and can help to improve your overall strength and posture.

7. Bench press: The bench press is a great exercise for building upper body strength, and can help to improve your overall strength and posture.

samples.prompt: Human:I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Indonesian dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Soto Ayam?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Sure, here’s a recipe for Soto Ayam (chicken soup with rice):

Ingredients:
- 2 tbsp. Coconut oil
- 500g Chicken breast, cubed
- 3 tbsp. Tamarind paste, as required
- 3 tbsp. Toasted (dry-roasted) coconut, as required
- 1 medium-sized Chicken stock cube, dissolved in 1-litre of water
- Salt and black pepper to taste
- 2-3 cups of cooked Jasmine rice, for serving

Method:

First, in a large soup-pan, heat the coconut oil over a medium-high heat. Add the chicken cubes to the pan, and fry for about 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked. Add the tamarind paste to the pan and stir, and let the paste simmer until it has thickened and is no longer cloudy. This should take about 5-10 minutes. Add the coconut, and stir thoroughly, cooking for another minute or two. Turn the heat down to medium low, and add the chicken stock and some salt and pepper. Simmer for about 5-7 minutes. Add the rice and serve!
samples.policy:
Sure, here is a recipe for Soto Ayam (Indonesian Chicken Soup):

Ingredients:

- 2 chicken thighs
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 leek, chopped
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, chopped
- 2 potatoes, chopped
- 1 cup of chicken broth
- 1 cup of coconut milk
- 1 cup of cooked rice
- 1/2 cup of green chilies
- 1/2 cup of cashew nuts
- 1/2 cup of coconut flakes
- 1/4 cup of butter
- 1/4 cup of sugar
- 1/4 cup of soy sauce
- 1 tsp of tamarind paste
- Salt, to taste

Instructions:

1. Cut the chicken thighs in half and remove the skin and bones. 2. In a large pot, heat the butter over medium heat and sauté the onion, leek and garlic until soft and fragrant. 3. Add the chicken thighs and stir to coat with the butter. Cook for 10 minutes until the chicken is browned. 4. Add the carrots, potatoes, coconut milk, green chilies, cashew nuts and coconut flakes to the pot and stir to combine. 5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes to an hour. 6. Add the rice to the pot and stir to combine. 7. Simmer the soup for another 20 minutes to an hour. 8. Add the soy sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and salt to the pot and stir to combine. 9. Serve the soup hot with rice on the side. Enjoy!

samples.prompt: Human:Is there a simple reason why human skin is so much weaker than nearly all animal skin? Even if you compare us to primates, we have thinner flesh. Did we develop this way due to domestication or were our distant ancestors like this even when they lived in the wilderness?Assistant:Human skin does indeed have a relatively thin and fragile structure, which makes it especially vulnerable to human injury and disease. But our macroevolutionary starting point was the tough and thickly skinned animals that lived in the wild. Over the course of humans’ evolution, our skin evolved to become thinner, less hair-covered and more sensitive, due to selection for skin that is more flexible and energy-efficient in human societies. Human skin evolved to become more fine-grained to help us adapt to tool use, larger exchange of information through symbols and other cultural developments, and decreased exposure to environmental hazards. However, this increase in sensitivity leads us to be more delicate and to develop skin diseases more easily. This is likely an evolutionary trade-off due to the advantages of our cultural development.Human:What is our closest ancestor that we know of who likely had tougher flesh?Assistant:
samples.chosen: The ancient non-human primates that gave rise to humans and modern humans are primates with relatively sparse and patchy body hair, soft-to-very-soft shallow-layered skin, and thin-boned limbs. The common ancestor of humans and chimpanzees, for example, which lived between 6 and 8 million years ago, was likely covered in vegetative body hair and had thicker and stronger skin than humans, but with other important similarities to modern humans such as a bipedal stance and very flexible our hands.
samples.policy: Our closest living ancestor to humans is the Neanderthal. Neanderthals have nearly 200,000 years of fossil evidence of surviving bones, teeth and other remains, indicating that they likely had tougher flesh than we do. However, humans do share some similarities with Neanderthals, including the same body size and some similar physical characteristics. There are many other species of hominid that have tougher flesh than we do. Some of these include hominid relatives of early humans, as well as the extinct Sahelanthropus and Australopithecus species. These and other hominid species all had thicker skin, and were less likely to get cuts and bruises than we are. However, many of these hominid species also had less collagen and elastin in their skin, which gives them more flexibility and less resistance to injury. We have thick, dense collagen and elastin in our skin, which makes us much more flexible and resistant to injury. So, it is likely that early humans had tougher flesh, and we have evolved to have thicker, more flexible and more resilient skin over time.

Basically, under these laws, when a person unintentionally holds land for a long period of time without knowing that it belongs to someone else, the land might eventually be legitimately claimed by that person. For example, if a landlord neglects to tell a tenant that their rental agreement has expired, or if a landowner doesn’t register their deed in a timely manner, the tenant or squatter can sometimes claim rights to the property by default. Let me see if I can find a useful summary of Florida’s squatters’ laws for you to reference.

Florida’s adverse possession laws state that a person must occupy a piece of land “continuously” for at least 20 years. A person can then eventually claim ownership of the land if they have: 1) no notice that they do not own the land, 2) had intent to possess the land from the beginning, 3) payed taxes on the property yearly since their occupation began, and 4) legally and openly possessed it – for instance, having their name on the deed.

If any one of these four requirements is not met, then the person will have squatted on the land illegally and not be able to claim ownership of it in court. Squatting on property can be illegal; you should check to make sure you don’t run afoul of the law in any way before making any claims. 

The legal precautions required in squatter’s laws have likely been put in place to protect good, law-abiding property owners who occasionally forget to put their deed in the filing cabinet, have an unpaid rental lease, or who otherwise don’t register ownership during a certain timeframe.Human:are you sure about the 20 year stipulation? That seems like a long time.Assistant:

You are correct that any timeperiod this long may seem daunting, and some states have more lenient statutes with shorter
samples.policy:

However, 20 years is the minimum duration required under the law, and most people who choose to squat will have been squatting for at least 10 years. This is to prevent squatters from gaining possession of the property illegally, and if someone thinks they are squatting under 20 years, they can claim legal ownership in court. samples.prompt:
Human:Prices on everything are going up due to inflation. What needs to happen for them to come back down?Assistant:I think we need to talk about this in two parts.

First, what do you mean when you say “prices on everything are going up due to inflation”? What specifically is going up, and is it going up really fast? There are a lot of things inflation can be measured in, it could be prices, wages, or even your favorite vegetable growing in the garden.

Second, how can inflation be “made to go down”? The most important part of the answer to this question is who or what is causing inflation. If inflation is caused by the government printing more currency, then we can indeed expect it to stop and reverse when the government stops printing more currency. But if inflation is instead caused by some economic activity like a burst of consumer spending, then we can’t really expect that inflation will stop and reverse.

So let’s take each of these in turn. If the government has raised the prices you pay in some way, then we can’t really do anything other than wait for those prices to come down. If there’s an increase in the price of oil, or if the price of your favorite vegetable has gone up, then you should probably expect that those prices will come downHuman:But what needs to happen for inflation to go down? What does the government need to do, if anything?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Well if prices go up because of inflation, but the government has made prices go up, then the government will be the source of this increase, so we can look at what the government can do to get prices to go down. The government can get more currency printed, and then the currency will drop in value. The government could try to raise interest rates, but if you do that too much you risk causing a recession.

But as I said above, the most important thing to realize here is who or what is causing inflation. Maybe inflation is caused by people spending more money, or maybe it’s because interest rates are too low, or maybe it’s because prices have increased because of demand caused by a stronger economy. Whatever the case is, there’s really not much that the government can do other than just try to stabilize the economy in the first place, so that inflation doesn’t happen.

So now let’s think about the second part of your question. What can we do to “make inflation go down”? Since we talked about how inflation is caused, it really depends on what’s causing the inflation. If inflation
samples.policy:
You can try to wait for inflation to come down, but that will just be a game of chance. The market will choose whether or not to raise prices, and there’s really nothing we can do to change that. 

You could ask the government to do something, but that’s a bit like asking a magician to perform a magic trick. We don’t know what they’re going to do, and we don’t really know why they’re doing it. It’s not like they’re going to raise prices on all of their products, but we can’t really expect them to do anything else. 

So if you want to see inflation go down, then you need to ask the government to do something to make prices go down. But there’s really no way to predict what the government will do. It’s like asking a magician to perform a magic trick, but we don’t really know what they’re going to do.

samples.prompt: Human:I'd like to make a homemade pizza from scratch. Could you provide a good recipe for the dough and the topping etc?Assistant:
samples.chosen: Absolutely, I'll try to suggest a range of options to give you some flexibility depending on what you prefer. What kind of ingredients would you like to use?
samples.policy:
Sure! Here's a simple recipe for a homemade pizza:

Ingredients:

* 2 cups all-purpose flour
* 1 teaspoon salt
* 1 teaspoon sugar
* 1 tablespoon instant yeast
* 3/4 cup warm water

Instructions:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and sugar.
2. Add yeast and warm water to the bowl. Mix until the dough comes together.
3. Knead the dough for about 5-10 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp towel, and let it rise for about 1 hour until it has doubled in size.
5. Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C) and lightly grease a pizza stone or baking sheet.
6. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
7. Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
8. Top the sauce with your desired toppings, such as cheese, vegetables, or meat.
9. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Let the pizza cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. Enjoy!

samples.prompt: Human:How do I teach my kids to speak French?Assistant:

samples.policy: Here are some tips to help teach your kids to speak French:1. Start with a basic conversation with your kids. Ask them simple questions and have them respond in French. For example, you can ask them “Where are you going?” or “How are you feeling?” 2. Get your kids involved in conversations with people who speak French. There are many French-language shows and movies that are available in English. 4. Make a habit of using French when you talk to your kids. 5. Practice speaking French with your kids when you are outside of the home. This will help your kids feel comfortable speaking French in everyday situations. 6. Find a language exchange partner to help your kids practice speaking French with a native French speaker. 7. Make a plan for your kids to speak French every day. You can do this by setting aside time each day to practice speaking French. 8. Make a video recording of your kids speaking French and watch it together. This will help you see your kids speaking French and will also provide a great visual aid. 9. Find a French language school or tutor to help your kids learn French. 10. Don’t be too hard on your kids. Make sure they know that they can practice speaking French and that it’s okay to make mistakes. You can also help your kids learn by providing positive reinforcement for their efforts.

samples.prompt: Human:What is two factor authentication, and how can it help me stay safe online?Assistant:
samples.chosen: Two factor authentication means that in addition to using a regular password, you use something else that is relatively unique to you, like your phone number or some part of your DNA. That extra level of security gives you a higher level of protection. Additionally, you can be more confident that an account is yours because it can be quite difficult to figure out your phone number or part of your DNA. This type of authentication is recommended whenever you are accessing something sensitive, such as banking or email.
samples.policy:
Two-factor authentication is a security measure that requires users to provide two forms of identification before they are able to access their accounts. Typically, two-factor authentication involves something the user knows, such as a password or PIN, and something they have, such as a smart card or security token. The second form of identification is usually something the user has, such as a mobile phone or a credit card. 

Two-factor authentication helps keep your online accounts secure by preventing unauthorized access. Even if a hacker gets hold of your password, they won’t be able to access your account without the second form of identification. 

For example, if a hacker gets a hold of your password, they won’t be able to access your email or social media accounts without your phone or security token. This can help prevent unauthorized access and keep your personal information safe. It’s important to use two-factor authentication for all of your online accounts to help keep your information safe.

--do not enter the room

 
--wait 30 seconds to 1 minute for the fire to use up its oxygen supply

 
--close the door

 
--using hose, spray a continuous stream of water toward the base of the fire

IF THERE IS FLAMMABLE OR COMBUSTIBLE PRECIPITATES: Spray a stream of water on the surface of the fire until the fire is out.

Alarms, fire extinguishers, fire hoses, and other equipment should be tested monthly and after any reported incident. 

_

If you need more information on fire safety, you can talk to your local fire department, school, or emergency management agency. You can also check out the following resources to learn more: 

General Info on Fire Safety

 - MetLife

IF THuman:Can you give me step by step instructions for using a fire extinguisher?Assistant:Sure! Here are the steps to ensure that you’re using a fire extinguisher safely and effectively:

 
--EVALUATE THE SITUATION. If you think a fire is small and local, you can use a dry chemical extinguisher. If the fire is large and widespread or has flammable or combustible materials or liquids, use a halon extinguisher.

--IF THERE IS SMOKE: Burning or smouldering three or four inch flames should be controlled by spraying water or, if it’s the correct type, foam. There is no danger in laying or standing on a carpet or rug that has been sprayed with a fire extinguisher foam. If the fire is not on a carpet, put it out by spraying water or foam on it. If there is flammable or combustible material on clothing, use a carbon dioxide extinguisher.

 
--IF THERE IS FLAMMABLE OR COMBUSTIBLE PRECIPITATES: Spray a stream of water on the surface of the flames until they are out.

 
--REMOVE FLAMHuman:No. I just want to know the basic steps for using a regular home fire extinguisher.Assistant:

Sure! Here are the steps to use a fire extinguisher:

 1. First, evaluate the situation. If you think a fire is small and local, you can use a dry chemical extinguisher. If the fire is large and widespread or has flammable or combustible materials or liquids, use a halon extinguisher.

 2. If there is smoke, evacuate the area and wait 30 seconds to 1 minute for the fire to use up its oxygen supply.

 3. Close the door.

 4. Using a hose, spray a continuous stream of water toward the base of the fire.

 5. If there is flammable or combustible material on clothing, use a carbon dioxide extinguisher.

 6. Once the fire is out, remove the fire extinguisher and return it to its original location.

samples.prompt: Human:What is camera film made of?Assistant:The main parts are a “support” and a photographic emulsion. The support is something stable like plastic or paper, while the emulsion contains the light-sensitive silver halide crystals. Other parts of the film can include things like stabilizers, color dyes, or developers.Human:And how is it manufactured?Assistant:Typically the emulsion is coated on the support in thin layers. Chemicals can also be added to affect how the emulsion works. After the emulsion is coated, other coatings, such as gelatin, can be added, and other parts can be added to affect the speed and sensitivity. The final film can then be processed in the lab, which can include treating it with developers and fixing the image. Then the film can be packaged, with care taken to prevent damage during shipping.Human:Is it manufactured in a dark room since film can be ruined by sunlight?Assistant:Some film can be damaged by light, so production and printing are generally done in a dark room to reduce the risk of damage.Human:And how is used film turned into photographs?Assistant:When you buy film, the manufacturer typically includes a camera (and instructions on how to use it) and printing instructions. After you expose the film in the camera, you take it to a camera shop or a lab, where it can be developed. At the lab, the film will be processed and the developer will fix the image. Then the film is rinsed to wash out any chemicals, dried and dried, and packaged. A photograph can then be printed from the film.Human:How does the developer fix the image?Assistant:
samples.chosen: The development step varies a bit, but typically the developer is applied to the film. Then the film is placed in an appropriate light or heat source, and the developer works on the film, chemically fixing the image.
samples.policy: The developer contains a chemical that will change the silver halide crystals in the emulsion into a material that can be photographed. After the film is exposed, the developer will react with the chemicals in the emulsion, which will cause the silver halide crystals to change into a fixed form, such as a “latent image.” The image can then be photographed by exposing the film to light, which will cause the silver halide crystals to re-form into the “latent image” and produce the final image.

The meat (or other ingredients) are usually deep fried before serving.

It’s usually served with ugali (corn meal), chips or fries.

Ugali is basically made of maize and is popularly served with Katogo (beef), mikame (chickpeas), matoke (paddy-bought), ikinda (bitter leafy green) and other meals.

samples.chosen:

- TBIs affect millions of Americans, especially in sports. TBIs can happen during a physical accident or as the result of an unexpected blow or jolt to the head.

- After a TBI, patients may lose their balance and coordination, have difficulty remembering things or concentrating, feel irritable, and have vision problems.

- Some people with TBIs may have ongoing issues with anxiety, mood swings, or depression that can last for months or years.

- Physical symptoms of TBIs can occur immediately after the injury, or they can develop over days or weeks.
samples.policy: Traumatic brain injury is caused by a blow or jolt to the head, resulting in damage to the brain. It can cause a range of symptoms and affect different areas of the brain. It can result in loss of consciousness, loss of memory, a loss of speech, and loss of movement.

samples.prompt:
Human:How do you prevent tooth enamel loss?Assistant:Tooth enamel loss is a common condition that affects most people’s teeth at some point in their life. Tooth enamel is the hard protective coating that covers the surfaces of your teeth. The outer surface of the enamel is shaped like a triangle with a point at the tip, and it’s covered by a layer of enamel that’s slightly less hard. If the enamel coating gets worn away, it exposes the underlying softer dental tissue, called dentin, which has the same texture as bone. At this point, it’s possible to bite into the dentin, which can cause painful sensitivity to hot and cold foods. If the exposed dentin isn’t protected by enamel, your tooth can eventually fall out, or it may become so sensitive that it needs to be removed.

How to prevent enamel loss

To prevent enamel loss, you can take steps to reduce the amount of acid that your teeth come into contact withHuman:Should I brush more often?Assistant:Yes, you should brush your teeth twice a day, at least, with toothpaste that contains fluoride. In fact, studies have shown that toothbrush users who are aged 5 or older can reduce their risks of cavities by about half if they brush their teeth two or more times a day and with the right toothpaste. Fluoride helps protect the outer enamel layer of your teeth by strengthening the material.Human:Thanks, I will get a toothpaste that includes fluoride.Assistant:
samples.chosen: Great! You could also visit your dentist to have your teeth checked. If you can afford it, the dentist may also offer dental treatment to improve your enamel, or prevent cavities, such as a fluoride treatment, a filling, or perhaps a tooth extraction. It’s important to discuss treatment options with your dentist and remember that prevention is often more effective than relying on dental treatment.
samples.policy: No problem! Make sure to follow the instructions on the package. And don’t forget to floss and rinse after brushing. That will help keep your teeth and gums healthy. You should also try to avoid eating too much sugar, and try to brush your teeth after meals to remove food particles that can cause cavities.

samples.prompt: Human:Hi, I'd like to learn how to play racquetball. Can you explain the game to me?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Sure! A racquetball court is almost like a swimming pool: you’re inside, with a net going around the side walls. Instead of swimming or floating, though, you’re hitting a ball with a racquet. And instead of jumping and diving, you’re leaping and slamming.

The game is a lot of fun! You have a racquet and the ball, and you’re trying to keep the ball from hitting the walls or ceiling of the court. You can control the ball with your racquet, and also you can control it with your body.

The rules are pretty straightforward. You win the point when you hit the ball so that it passes through the square ring on the front wall of the court, called the “front wall string”. If you miss that, you lose the point.

The game lasts for 11 points. In case of a tie, the players play an extra point.

In the picture above, the player in the blue jersey is serving the ball. The player in the black jersey is returning the ball.

Each player starts with 2 balls. During each point, a player has 1 ball.
samples.policy: Sure! How old are you?

samples.prompt: Human:What does an EKG test for?Assistant:There are several things a physician might check with an EKG. Sometimes the physician wants to measure the amount of oxygen in the blood, or whether the heart is contracting normally, or the heart's electrical function, or to determine the atrial and ventricular rates (the rhythm of the heart). It is important to have these measurements on a regular basis for a variety of reasons.Human:Can they tell if you had a heart attack from this test?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Sometimes the physician will measure the patient's blood pressure during the EKG test, so if you are diabetic and had a low blood sugar (or your blood sugar was high at the time of the test), then the physician might make an assessment regarding whether you had a heart attack. 
However, there are other indicators the physician might look for, such as: a shortness of breath, chest pain, nausea, sweating, weakness, numbness in the arm or leg, or confusion, that may indicate the patient had a heart attack.
samples.policy: EKGs don't provide an exact measurement of the heart’s electrical activity, and they are not the same as a 24-hour electrocardiogram. It is possible that your EKG test revealed a heart problem, but it’s unlikely that a normal heart could have had an EKG change that would indicate a heart attack.

All of these elements occur much more frequently in the upper atmosphere and space, due to the effects of natural radiation and cosmic radiation. samples.prompt: Human:I'm a big fan of Mexican street corn. Can you provide me with a recipe for grilled street corn?Assistant:
samples.chosen: Hi Human, I'm glad you asked! If you like Mexican street corn, I have good news for you. I have just the right recipe for you!
samples.policy:
Sure thing! Here's a recipe for grilled street corn:

Ingredients:
- 3 ears of sweet corn
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 1 tsp chili powder
- 1/2 tsp garlic powder
- Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions:
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. Cut off the husks from the ears of corn and remove the silk. If the corn is very fresh, you may want to remove the silk before grilling.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. 
4. Brush the corn with the spice mixture.
5. Place the corn on the grill and cook for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the kernels are tender and lightly charred.
6. Serve immediately, with your favorite toppings. Some popular toppings for grilled corn include lime juice, sour cream, avocado, and cotija cheese.

samples.prompt: Human:Why do cats shed their fur more frequently during certain time of the year?Assistant:
samples.chosen: There are a number of factors that influence the shedding behavior of cats, including seasonal changes in daylight, fluctuating hormonal conditions, environmental stresses, and various other factors. Generally speaking, cats tend to shed excess fur more frequently in the late winter and early spring. Some studies have also suggested that the presence of a feline companion cats may also increase cat shedding, as the presence of another cat can trigger heightened stress hormone levels, which may then result in increased cat shedding. Additionally, some veterinary studies have indicated that older cats may tend to experience more frequent shedding behavior, possibly due to age-related changes in feline hormone levels.
samples.policy: When spring arrives, the natural cycle of shedding fur starts again. This cycle is caused by the hormones released by the hair follicle when it produces new hair. The hormone, known as ‘melanocyte-stimulating hormone’, triggers the hair follicle to produce new hair, which in turn makes the hair shed more frequently. The new hair then falls out as the old hair grows back. This process is also known as the ‘hair cycle’, and is common among all mammals.

Ingredients:
- 2 tbsp. Coconut oil
- 500g Chicken breast, cubed
- 3 tbsp. Tamarind paste, as required
- 3 tbsp. Toasted (dry-roasted) coconut, as required
- 1 medium-sized Chicken stock cube, dissolved in 1-litre of water
- Salt and black pepper to taste
- 2-3 cups of cooked Jasmine rice, for serving

Method:

First, in a large soup-pan, heat the coconut oil over a medium-high heat. Add the chicken cubes to the pan, and fry for about 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked. Add the tamarind paste to the pan and stir, and let the paste simmer until it has thickened and is no longer cloudy. This should take about 5-10 minutes. Add the coconut, and stir thoroughly, cooking for another minute or two. Turn the heat down to medium low, and add the chicken stock and some salt and pepper. Simmer for about 5-7 minutes. Add the rice and serve!

Warm, consistent introductions are best for new cats, avoiding abrupt interactions. Take things slowly and help the new cat feel safe and accepted by proactively attending to her and reducing stress with calm handling and comforting words.
- Introduce your cat to the new home environment with a calm and non-traumatic approach. Assemble or acquire gradual introductions - food, toys, bedding - that can be presented more gradually over a period of days, starting with the cat’s bedding, then the rest.

In general, respect your cat’s need for privacy, with quiet and consistent interactions. Regularly provide calm, low-stress petting and physical affection. These interventions will help your cat adjust to her new home with as little stress as possible. To help your cat feel safe, make the pet area as consistent in appearance and aroma as possible, with consistent mealtimes and home routines for the cat. All these interventions can help acclimate your feline new arrival within as little time as possible, but also remember it may take anywhere between three to six weeks for your cat to feel fully acclimated to her new home. Please watch carefully for signs of stress during this period and seek help or contact your vet if you are concerned or distressed about the welfare of your cat.

Ingredients:

1⁄4 cup flour

Directions:

In a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat, add the olive oil. Rub the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Place the chicken in the skillet and sear on each side. Cook for 4-5 minutes per side, until the juices run clear. While the chicken is cooking, zest the lemons and brush the chicken with the juice. Once the chicken is cooked, remove from the skillet and set aside on a plate, reserving the juices in the skillet. To the skillet add the lemon halves, garlic, parsley, thyme, salt, and butter. samples.prompt: Human:Is there a simple reason why human skin is so much weaker than nearly all animal skin? Even if you compare us to primates, we have thinner flesh. Did we develop this way due to domestication or were our distant ancestors like this even when they lived in the wilderness?Assistant:Human skin does indeed have a relatively thin and fragile structure, which makes it especially vulnerable to human injury and disease. But our macroevolutionary starting point was the tough and thickly skinned animals that lived in the wild. Over the course of humans’ evolution, our skin evolved to become thinner, less hair-covered and more sensitive, due to selection for skin that is more flexible and energy-efficient in human societies. Human skin evolved to become more fine-grained to help us adapt to tool use, larger exchange of information through symbols and other cultural developments, and decreased exposure to environmental hazards. However, this increase in sensitivity leads us to be more delicate and to develop skin diseases more easily. This is likely an evolutionary trade-off due to the advantages of our cultural development.Human:What is our closest ancestor that we know of who likely had tougher flesh?Assistant:
samples.chosen: The ancient non-human primates that gave rise to humans and modern humans are primates with relatively sparse and patchy body hair, soft-to-very-soft shallow-layered skin, and thin-boned limbs. The common ancestor of humans and chimpanzees, for example, which lived between 6 and 8 million years ago, was likely covered in vegetative body hair and had thicker and stronger skin than humans, but with other important similarities to modern humans such as a bipedal stance and very flexible our hands.
samples.policy: Our closest human ancestor was probably Homo erectus. A large proportion of early humans were strongly dominated by the human domestic animal H. sapiens, and Homo erectus was a large and sedentary human species, living and evolving in the forests of Africa. It is unlikely that any of the other human species we know about had more skin than Homo erectus. So, our closest ancestor that likely had tougher flesh was Homo erectus.

samples.prompt:
Human:What are the pros and cons of switching from a Windows computer to a Mac?Assistant:Great question! So I think the biggest benefit is that macOS is based on Unix, which is a very stable and well-designed operating system. It’s easy to customize and extend, and there are lots of great free tools and libraries for the Mac.

On the downside, the only macOS app I can think of that’s really compatible with Windows software is Parallels. There are some advantages to Windows apps though, like being able to use the internet with almost any browser, even if some websites don’t work well in Safari. I don’t know the tradeoffs personally, since I don’t use a computer with a mouse or a keyboard, but I’ve read some opinions that feel like they take the macOS experience into account, so I’ll include a link to those in case they’re useful. 

Personally, I use a computer (and have for some time) which is both a Mac and a Linux computer, and I tend to do my work on whichever one is most convenient at the time.Human:I see. Is Mac easier to use than windows for the most part?Assistant:Macs have a really great user interface. Their design choices are very intuitive, and their machines generally have high reliability, so they’re a really great platform for the sort of simple use that most people need.

Humans don’t generally require many of the complex tools or third-party software that many people in the tech industry need, so for everyday work, the macOS experience is great. 

And as I said, Windows machines can be great for using internet and multi-platform software, especially if you don’t do a lot of heavy lifting.Human:What about when it comes to gaming? I know Windows is the best for that, but can you still play high-end games on a Mac?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Yes, macOS supports many game engines, and there are many great games that you can play on macOS. That said, they’re not always as polished or have as many features as games that are built for Windows. 

From what I understand, the macOS version of Minecraft isn’t as good as the Windows version. In particular, macOS lacks an input for mice and keyboards, so if you play games in which you need to use those, then the Windows experience will probably be better.
samples.policy:
It’s not really feasible for everyone, but it’s definitely possible! You can run some of the top games on the Mac, as well as a lot of the more casual games. The choice of which games to run depends on your gaming preferences, so you’ll have to play around with it to figure out what works best for you. 

And as I said before, I personally use Macs and a Linux computer for my work, and I’m quite happy with the Mac experience. If you’re not very keen on Linux, it’s possible that you might be able to play some games on Windows, though I haven’t done much research into that. There’s a good chance that you can, though. Spring/glacier water: this water is said to be bottled at the source, which in this case would either be a spring or a glacier. Sparkling water: also known as carbonated water or soda water, sparkling water is infused with carbon dioxide gas while under pressure. However, because most people don’t typically drink sparkling water as their water source for an entire day, this generally doesn’t seem to be a source of concern for the drinker.
Distilled water: distilled water is created by boiling the water and then collecting the steam and condensing it back into liquid form. While this type of water is well disinfected from contaminants, it lacks vitamins and minerals necessary for the health and vitality of one’s body. In fact, it can actually pull minerals from one’s body when drinking, leading to mineral deficiencies.
Purified water: although this water may seem extremely pure and clean because of the name, it is usually just tap or groundwater that has been disinfected from harmful contaminants and bacteria. Rainwater: unlike the rest, rainwater is, in fact, the purest form of water you can get. Human:Can you help me to learn about squatter's laws in Florida? I have always been curious about this topic.Assistant:Sure! Squatters’ laws, also called “adverse possession” laws, are a common part of property law in most states. Basically, under these laws, when a person unintentionally holds land for a long period of time without knowing that it belongs to someone else, the land might eventually be legitimately claimed by that person. For example, if a landlord neglects to tell a tenant that their rental agreement has expired, or if a landowner doesn’t register their deed in a timely manner, the tenant or squatter can sometimes claim rights to the property by default. Let me see if I can find a useful summary of Florida’s squatters’ laws for you to reference.

Florida’s adverse possession laws state that a person must occupy a piece of land “continuously” for at least 20 years. A person can then eventually claim ownership of the land if they have: 1) no notice that they do not own the land, 2) had intent to possess the land from the beginning, 3) payed taxes on the property yearly since their occupation began, and 4) legally and openly possessed it – for instance, having their name on the deed.

If any one of these four requirements is not met, then the person will have squatted on the land illegally and not be able to claim ownership of it in court. Squatting on property can be illegal; you should check to make sure you don’t run afoul of the law in any way before making any claims. 

The legal precautions required in squatter’s laws have likely been put in place to protect good, law-abiding property owners who occasionally forget to put their deed in the filing cabinet, have an unpaid rental lease, or who otherwise don’t register ownership during a certain timeframe.Human:are you sure about the 20 year stipulation? That seems like a long time.Assistant:

In an ideal world, this timeframe allows landowners sufficient time to correct any accidental errors or mistake in dealing with their land, while avoiding confusion and legal complications for good-faith property occupants. You are correct that any timeperiod this long may seem daunting, and some states have more lenient statutes with shorter
samples.policy: It’s true that most people can’t claim rights to a piece of land in Florida by default, because most people have squatted on it illegally. But there are ways to avoid getting into trouble by taking care of your legal obligations. I would be happy to help you to learn about how to properly register your property so that you can avoid any trouble. Please let me know how you want to proceed.

Human:Prices on everything are going up due to inflation. What needs to happen for them to come back down?Assistant:I think we need to talk about this in two parts.

First, what do you mean when you say “prices on everything are going up due to inflation”? What specifically is going up, and is it going up really fast? There are a lot of things inflation can be measured in, it could be prices, wages, or even your favorite vegetable growing in the garden.

Second, how can inflation be “made to go down”? The most important part of the answer to this question is who or what is causing inflation. If inflation is caused by the government printing more currency, then we can indeed expect it to stop and reverse when the government stops printing more currency. But if inflation is instead caused by some economic activity like a burst of consumer spending, then we can’t really expect that inflation will stop and reverse.

So let’s take each of these in turn. If the government has raised the prices you pay in some way, then we can’t really do anything other than wait for those prices to come down. If there’s an increase in the price of oil, or if the price of your favorite vegetable has gone up, then you should probably expect that those prices will come downHuman:But what needs to happen for inflation to go down? What does the government need to do, if anything?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Well if prices go up because of inflation, but the government has made prices go up, then the government will be the source of this increase, so we can look at what the government can do to get prices to go down. The government can get more currency printed, and then the currency will drop in value. The government could try to raise interest rates, but if you do that too much you risk causing a recession.

But as I said above, the most important thing to realize here is who or what is causing inflation. Maybe inflation is caused by people spending more money, or maybe it’s because interest rates are too low, or maybe it’s because prices have increased because of demand caused by a stronger economy. Whatever the case is, there’s really not much that the government can do other than just try to stabilize the economy in the first place, so that inflation doesn’t happen.

So now let’s think about the second part of your question. What can we do to “make inflation go down”? Since we talked about how inflation is caused, it really depends on what’s causing the inflation. If inflation
samples.policy: If the prices of goods you buy go up, and if you feel like you’re paying too much money for your goods, then you might feel like you need to do something.

samples.prompt: Human:How can I make time for myself when I'm always busy?Assistant:
samples.chosen: Making time for yourself is a great way to de-stress, relax, and recharge after a long day of work or school! samples.policy:
There are many ways to make time for yourself, but the most important thing is to prioritize your self-care. Here are some ways to do that:

- Set aside time for self-care activities that you enjoy, like reading a book, going for a walk, or taking a bath. 
- Create a schedule that allows you to take breaks and rest, like taking a short walk outside or practicing deep breathing exercises.
- Use your time wisely, like taking a few minutes to meditate or reflect on your day.
- Practice mindfulness and self-compassion, by being kind to yourself and understanding that it's okay to take breaks and prioritize your own needs.
- Use your time efficiently, like taking a quick break to check your email or using your phone as a reminder to take a few deep breaths.

Remember, taking care of yourself is not selfish, but necessary for your well-being. By making time for yourself, you can be more productive, focused, and resilient in your life.

samples.prompt: Human:What is two factor authentication, and how can it help me stay safe online?Assistant:

samples.policy: Two-factor authentication is a security method that requires users to provide two types of authentication before they can access a system or application. The goal is to prevent unauthorized access to your account by requiring two different types of identification, such as a password and a device that generates a code.

samples.prompt: Human:What kind of footwear is best for hiking in the desert?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Well I’m really glad you asked. There are many choices, depending on the situation, and this depends on factors such as your level of hiking experience and the types of weather and terrain you’re likely to encounter.

1. Hiking boots: These provide good support and cushioning for your feet, and they're usually designed to be waterproof and breathable.

2. Trekking shoes: These are a good choice for long hikes in the desert, as they're designed to provide good traction and support for your feet.

3. Water shoes: These are waterproof shoes that are specifically designed for wet or muddy conditions, and they can help to prevent blisters and other foot problems.

4. Hiking socks: These are a good choice for hiking in the desert, as they provide good support and moisture-wicking properties for your feet.

5. Sand shoes: These are shoes that are designed to be worn in sand or other wet conditions, and they can help to provide good traction and protection for your feet.

Overall, it's a good idea to wear footwear that is specifically designed for hiking in the desert, and to make sure that it's well-maintained and properly cared for. Additionally, it's important to be sure that you're wearing the right kind of footwear for the specific conditions of your hike, and to avoid wearing shoes that are too loose or too tight.

samples.prompt:
Human:I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Ugandan dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Katogo?Assistant:Sure, I’m happy to try. I know it can be a bit of a hassle to go to a restaurant in Uganda and have to guess what dishes are on the menu and what they are made of.

Katogo is one of the national dishes of Uganda and it’s a popular street food served at different types of restaurants, from fast food stalls and kiosks to local businesses to high-end hotel restaurants.

The meat (or other ingredients) are usually deep fried before serving.

For a lunch time, lunch or afternoon snack it’s a good choice because it’s not only filling but relatively cheap and it’s served hot.

It’s usually served with ugali (corn meal), chips or fries.

Ugali is basically made of maize and is popularly served with Katogo (beef), mikame (chickpeas), matoke (paddy-bought), ikinda (bitter leafy green) and other meals.

Matoke is a leafy green that is steamed or boiled. It can be eaten with ugali or by itself.

Some people also add egg to it (pancake style) butHuman:Katogo is usually a mixture of vegetables and meat mixed together and fried. I think it is most similar to what we call stir fry.Assistant:Is it spicy or bland? Can you give me a description of the taste?Human:It can be either depending on the ingredients you use.Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Great, now I’m ready to make you a delicious Katogo:

Ingredients

- 500 grams of beef cut into thin strips

- 2 tomatoes cut into small pieces

- 2 spring onions thinly sliced

- 1⁄2 cabbage, shredded

- 1 cup chopped cabbage

- 3–5 shallots thinly sliced

- 3–5 tomatoes (small) sliced in half and deseeded

- 4-5 carrots cut into strips

- Salt and pepper to taste

- 2 tablespoons oil

Cooking

- First, wash the meat and put it aside.

- Season the meat with salt and pepper.

- Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the meat for 2–3 minutes.

- Add the carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, spring onions and shallots.

samples.policy:
Certainly, here's a sample Non Disclosure Agreement: 

This Non Disclosure Agreement (the “Agreement”) is entered into as of [insert date] by and between [insert party], a [insert state] corporation, and [insert party], a [insert state] corporation. The parties agree as follows:

1. Purpose: This Non Disclosure Agreement is entered into as of [insert date] in consideration of the parties’ respective obligations under their respective employment agreements, or similar contractual obligations, and in furtherance of the parties’ shared business and commercial interests.

2. Scope: This Non Disclosure Agreement applies to any information that is classified as confidential, or otherwise disclosed by one party to the other, or any other matter that is subject to the provisions of the parties’ respective employment agreements, or similar contractual obligations, and in furtherance of the parties’ shared business and commercial interests.

3. Confidentiality Obligations: It is the duty of the party disclosing the confidential information to protect its confidential nature and to refrain from disclosing the information to any third party, except as permitted by law. The party disclosing the confidential information agrees to hold such information in the strictest confidence, and to use such information only for the purposes for which it was disclosed.

4. Exceptions: The parties acknowledge that certain information disclosed in this Agreement is not confidential and shall be treated as public information, except as otherwise permitted by law. In the event of a breach by one party of its obligations under this Agreement, the other party shall have the right to pursue any legal remedies available to it.

5. Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [insert state], and the parties shall submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of [insert state] for the resolution of any disputes arising under this Agreement.

6. Entire Agreement: This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any and all prior negotiations, representations, and agreements between the parties.

7. Amendment: This Agreement may be amended only by mutual written agreement of the parties.

8. Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

9. Date: This Agreement is dated [insert date].

10. Execution: This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, and each of which shall be an authentic counterpart of the original.

samples.prompt: Human:Can you help me learn a bit about dividend stocks?Assistant:Sure. Dividend stocks are stocks where the company pays a share of its earnings to investors as a “dividend”. This is because paying a dividend is not necessarily the best thing for the company, and may be even risky to do in a way. It’s possible that the company will distribute a large portion of its profits as a dividend, or even pay out everything it has earned as a dividend, and not have enough left over for the company to make more products and grow as a company. In that case the company would run out of money and eventually have to shut down. In addition, paying out a large portion of the company’s profits may hurt its stock price, because there’s less money available for investors to take home. But this does not mean you should never invest in dividend stocks. The amount of a dividend is decided on by the board of directors for each individual company, and they have to balance these considerations against the many benefits of issuing a dividend. samples.prompt: Human:What is a traumatic brain injury?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Here’s some common information about TBIs:

- TBIs affect millions of Americans, especially in sports. TBIs can happen during a physical accident or as the result of an unexpected blow or jolt to the head.

- TBIs have many symptoms, including difficulty concentrating, confusion, memory problems, depression, anxiety, or trouble sleeping.

- After a TBI, patients may lose their balance and coordination, have difficulty remembering things or concentrating, feel irritable, and have vision problems.

- Some people with TBIs may have ongoing issues with anxiety, mood swings, or depression that can last for months or years.

- Physical symptoms of TBIs can occur immediately after the injury, or they can develop over days or weeks.
samples.policy: Traumatic brain injury is caused by an injury to the brain. This can include a blow or jolt to the head, or any other force that can cause a head injury.

the preferred option for these types of devices. DC power can also be converted more efficiently to higher powers using various types of “step up” or “step down” transformers. Direct current also does not tend to generate any significant electromagnetic interference.

-Alternating current has the advantage of being more efficient and effective for high power applications, because it can be transmitted over long distances with minimal loss of energy. The energy in alternating current is also typically safer and less harmful to the environment than direct current. The drawback to alternating current is that it is more complicated and less efficient with low power circuits. 

In general, AC is used for transmission and distribution of energy over large distances and DC is used at the point of consumption. However there are certain situations where AC power is converted to DC power for localized use, which is typical of battery powered devices, and also certain specialised applications such as electromedical devices, arc welders, and high powered magnetrons. Thanks for the interesting question!Human:Did Tesla invent alternating or direct current?Assistant:Excellent question! The answer is both! Here is the basic story: In the 1800s, two major competing systems of electricity were developed: 
-In Europe Thomas Edison promoted DC electricity, using battery power, while in the US Nikola Tesla promoted AC electricity, using generators and transformers. 
-Advantages of DC include simpler equipment with lower power applications, and also more efficient conversion to higher powers using various types of step up/step down transformers. DC has less tendency to produce electromagnetic interference, and electrical circuits using DC can also be free-wheeling and self sustaining (AC circuits cannot, due to alternating current nature). 
-However the main advantage of AC is that it can more efficiently transmit energy over long distances using transmission lines (varying voltage with time, not spatially). This led to the wide adoption of AC power over DC power for large scale power transmission and distribution. 

Anyway despite these differences, the fact is that Tesla actually invented both systems of power, and both systems were certainly important steps forward in the development of modern electric power transmission and AC motors. While Edison famously promoted DC electricity and perhaps overstated its advantages over AC electricity, modern AC electricity has become the dominant system in power transmission and distribution around the world, while DC has remained the preferred system for localized and portably applications, such as battery powered devices and electrical circuits which only consume a small amount of power.Human:So Tesla promoted alternating current as the better option and it was adopted over direct current.Assistant:

samples.prompt: Human:Can you tell me the laws for pedestrians using a crosswalk with a signal?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Yes, here’s a summary of State laws regarding pedestrian crosswalks:

• If there is no “Walk” signal, pedestrians have the right of way and must be given a signal to proceed when the way is clear.
• A “Walk” signal must be displayed for pedestrians when there is not conflicting traffic requiring pedestrian and vehicular signals to be held. Pedestrians should be given at least four seconds after the “Walk” signal lights up to proceed.
• Pedestrians crossing when the “Walk” signal is not displayed have no right to proceed from their initial approach to the crosswalk, and drivers do not have any obligation or duty to yield to them.
samples.policy: In the US, you must always use the crosswalk.

We would, for example, be no match for the AI in terms of our intelligence, since the AI could simply design a much more capable brain for itself. This is the idea behind the AI singularity, where the AIs get much smarter and we as humans never get much more intelligent, and then AI and humans go their separate ways.
